definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: I abhor people who wage paper-warfare.
sentences.chinese: 我痛恨那些打筆戰的人。

sentences.english: Personal attacks or purposeless inflammatory posts is not allowed.
sentences.chinese: 禁止人身攻擊或是筆戰。

definition: to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to be reluctant to give up a post
